Text.Value: Not just alive - victorious. I killed it.
Fuck yes - let's do it! I want to crush something evil.
Holy hells. Incredible, that it didn't tear off your every limb.
What? Hideous beast! It is a miracle you're alive.
We must take this advantage. Githyanki perish in bloodbaths, not dreary curses.
I'm with the Harper. We should take every advantage in reach.
Just as I'm no stranger to the scars it leaves behind.
But - there will be more chances. You'll make them. It's what you do.
Prudent words. As I expected.
Even in deepest darkness -
Gotta be a Moonlantern. Just what we need.
You don't just fight shadows. You fight what hides inside.
If they move freely, they must have a Moonlantern. Let's have a little war with that convoy and claim the spoils.
Damn it all.
Mind the gap between confidence and arrogance, True Soul. That's where true danger lies.
Go on, then - take your lantern, or not. Moonrise is waiting.
You're too late - I've encountered the convoy, led by a drider.
Sounds like just what we need to get to Moonrise.
I only saw its trail. It was fresh.
Isobel's blessing is a palliative, not a cure. Some shadows, even her magic can't counter.
A Moonlantern, I wager. There's no overstating the advantage we'll gain with that light.
- you will shine.
If they move freely, they must have some kind of magic that protects them. I'm not averse to claiming that magic indeed.
It's refreshing not to have set the trap I'm springing - take me to the convoy.
Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.
Yes, I've taken their light. I will be safe in its glow.
Don't be long. Our window of chance will close all too quickly.
Yet the cultists have found a way to move freely. Whatever this method, you must claim it.
So glad to have you. Truly.
The path to the Towers is drenched in blackness so deep, even a torch cannot quell it.
Wait here. I need time to prepare.
And so are we.
Forget the convoy. I can handle myself out there.
A magic lantern. It'll help. But it's only a tool, not a solution.
Splendid. I'll mark your map, should you lose the way.
A Moonlantern - it must be. And we must take it. Githyanki perish in bloodbaths, not dreary curses.
I wasn't able to retrieve it, I'm afraid. The way will be dark indeed.
Shouldn't Isobel's blessing keep me safe?
Not a miracle - I was simply careful. I saw its light in the distance.
Jaheira said Isobel had a way to keep me safe.
I'll be damned - you're something else.
Sounds like an opportunity. And it would be nice to surprise the Absolute for once.
Hells. Then our chance has passed.
Is that it, then? I'm no stranger to indifference, True Soul.
A Moonlantern, surely? I would love to have one of those.
I stayed well out of its way. There was no chance of it spotting me.
My feet are planted deep 'til you return.
Forget the convoy. I am your saviour here, not some magic lamp.
Harpers - with me. Stray no more than an arm's length from your course.
Shrug.
You mean to reach Moonrise. And I've orders to help you.
Then it has already travelled to Moonrise.
Sounds like a Moonlantern - that's just what we need.
And their means of safe passage - do you have it?
Say the word, and we set the ambush in motion.
Go on ahead. I'll catch up.
Go, then - Moonrise Towers awaits. But know this:
A cultist convoy crosses the land as we speak. I've readied an ambush. Say the word, and we fly.
But don't tarry. The greater the opportunity, the shorter its visit.
As you say. I'll mark your map with the rendezvous point.

Synopsis: The players encounter a squad of Harpers at the Last Light Inn who're preparing to set out on a dangerous mission to ambush a drider and some cultists in the shadow-cursed lands. Lassandra, a Harper scout that the player may have helped previously, might be there.
